page.title: 03The Meridale Youth Club.
page.content: The youth club is held at the Meridale Hall which is by the sea front.The youth club is where young people go for the night to play games.{Mr Monk runs it.He has worked there for 20 years.It opened in 1965 and he enjoys organising games and going to our school.The people at the club do jobs as well as playing.{Mr Monk}likes being at the club but he doesn't get paid as it is voluntary.The building was built in 1905 as a lifeboat house. It is open 2 nights a week and the average attendance is 38 but there used to be more.It is 15p to get in nightly.The yearly membership fee is 60p.They play music from the Top Ten. The games they play are table tennis, pool,darts,video games,5 a side football,tug of war,weightlifting and other things.{Mr Monk's}assistant is {Neil Bromwich.
